text: Casimir Kendziorski (December 3, 1898 - September 26, 1974) was a Democratic member of the Wisconsin Senate, representing the 3rd District from 1949 until 1974. Born in Poland, he previously served in the Wisconsin Assembly, from 1946 to 1949. He lived in Milwaukee, Wisconsin.'Wisconsin Blue Book 1973,' Biographical Sketch of Casimir Kendziorski, pg. 26. Kendziorski died in a hospital in Milwaukee, Wisconsin.'Sen. Kendziorski Is Dead at 75,' Madison Capital Times, September 26, 1974, pg. 1 He was a past vice-president of his local trade union. He was active in civic and labor activities.'Wisconsin Blue Book 1968,' Biographical Sketch of Casimir Kendziorski, pg. 21 ==See also== *List of Polish Americans ==References== ==External links== * Category:Wisconsin state senators Category:Members of the Wisconsin State Assembly Category:Politicians from Milwaukee Category:1898 births Category:1974 deaths Category:Polish emigrants to the United States Category:American people of Polish descent Category:20th-century American politicians
title: Casimir Kendziorski
